mission: Rattlesnake ferns are one of the few ferns that remain edible through the growing season. In autumn, they turn reddish brown after being touched with frost, which sweetens them slightly. Find and compare fresh and frosty rattlesnake ferns
Ostrich fern fiddleheads are commonly served in restuarants around Vermont, and have a brewery named after them. Find out what all the hype is about!
Tufted shoots of the common blackberry are a specialized structure that occurs from cutting or browsing of the regular shoots in early summer. Get them before the deer do!
There has been a lot of buzz about pine pollen as a health supplement and a gourmet ingredient… Time to see for yourself: tap the male cones over a container and sift out any insects.
Spruce tips are reputed to be a tangy and aromatic addition to salads and smoothies!
This is Sam Thayer's favorite nut, and it makes an exceptional hickory milk, which sounds delicious
Red oak has the most abundant and labor-efficient acorns for shelling. The squirrels love them, do you?
Surely if Nutella is as good as it is, the nut milk must be worth trying
This makes one of Sam's favorite jams, but it is too sour for many… Is that a challenge?
Title food of Robin Wall Kimmer's new book. Join the ranks of those it services: try them fresh and dried.
These flowers are available in immense quantity and are "maybe the best edible flower in the world". Sounds worth trying. Eat them by the handful, in salads, soup, or ice cream.
Climb a green mountain for a taste of wild strawberry with a burst of crisp wintergreen
Cranberries are associated with sphagnum moss, only found in highly acidic bogs. Gather some wild berries for a saucy treat, just don't become a bog body!
It seems that this berry is only observed on and around Mount Mansfield. Don't take a ton home, but a treasure hunt is better than a hike.
Individual autumnberry bushes can produce several gallons of berries. They are also high in lycopene, a phytonutrient that may promote prostate health!
Is the highbush blueberry better than it's domesticated partner? Search high and low to find out!
Sumacade can range from inferior to excellent in quality. Get ripe, red berries before too much rain and taste them before beginning a brew
One of the more potent and popular wild teas, it has been used since the revolutionary war.
Propel a small boat through the rice and knock seeds into the boat with a stick. Dry, rub, and winnow to discover an Indigenous staple
Young corms have a sugarcane flavor, a secret the muskrats have hid well.
Many other parts of cattails are edible, but the lateral shoots are best, eaten raw or cooked.
Wild watercress is the same stuff you find for an exorbitant amount of money in the store. Find some calcium rich streams for a steep discount!
Also called water caltrops (!), water-chestnut is highly invasive, but also highly delicious! Two birds, one stone!
